title: Katie Piper shares heartbreaking photo of acid attack injuries
text:
Katie was brutally attacked in 2008 (Picture: Katie Piper Instagram, Rex)

Katie Piper has bravely shared a photo revealing the extent of her horrific acid attack injuries to raise awareness for World Mental Health Day.

The former Strictly Come Dancing star was brutally attacked by a man who was hired by her bitter ex-boyfriend, Daniel Lynch, in 2008.

As a result of the attack, Katie was left blind in one eye and severe burns mostly on her face.

To mark World Mental Health Day, the TV star shared a previously unseen photo believed to be taken not long after the incident, showing the severe burns on her face.

In the heartfelt caption, Katie explained: ‘I remember when I didn’t want to look at anyone. I remember when I didn’t want anyone to look at me. I remember when I was scared of people, scared of men.

‘I remember when I was scared of the world. I remember when opening up to people and talking about my trauma and psychological damage just wasn’t possibly.’

She added: ‘Today on Mental Health Day my first meeting of the day is with my therapist. I still go, it still helps and I’m able to talk.’

Sharing some final words of encouragement for anyone battling mental health issues, Katie concluded: ‘Hold On Pain Ends #mentalhealthawareness#mentalhealthday @wmhday [sic].’

The 35-year-old was flooded with messages of support from her followers, including Towie star Maria Fowler who said: ‘so sad to see you like that. You’re an inspiration to so many people. So much respect.’

One described her as their ‘hero’ while another praised: ‘You are an incredible human being.’

Another of Katie’s supporters said: ‘You’re amazing. What a wonderful opportunity you’ve taken to turn something awful into a wonderful way to inspire others.’

Earlier this year, Katie reveals how she explains her acid attack burns to her five-year-old daughter Belle, who has become curious about her mother’s appearance.

‘Me and my daughter have a lot of open conversations. My eldest is quite funny. She knows what happened,’ Katie told the audience at Women’s Health Live in May.

‘She’ll say, “Why do you have lumps and wrinkles round your eyes?” I’ll say, ‘It’s skin graft – where I got burnt, and I’m ageing.’
